items.title: Network Security Basics
items.description: This course introduces you to the foundational concepts of network security, essential for protecting systems and data from unauthorized access and attacks. You'll explore the core principles of network security, such as the importance of encryption, firewalls, and intrusion detection systems. You'll also learn how different network protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS) function and how vulnerabilities in these protocols can be exploited by cyber attackers. Topics covered include types of network attacks (such as man-in-the-middle, denial of service, and spoofing), common security measures like Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), and the significance of strong password policies. By the end of this session, you'll have a solid understanding of how to identify potential threats and safeguard a network against malicious activity.

sections.title: Understanding Networks and Protocols
sections.desc: Explanation of how networks function and the role of protocols in data communication.

sections.title: Common Network Vulnerabilities
sections.desc: Review of common network weaknesses that are frequently targeted by attacks.

sections.title: How Cyber Attacks Target Networks
sections.desc: Case studies of cyberattacks on networks and their impacts.

sections.title: Protecting Networks: Firewalls and Intrusion Detection
sections.desc: The role of firewalls and intrusion detection systems in securing networks.

items.title: Website Security Basics
items.description: Exploring how websites work, common threats to websites, and theoretical guidelines for securing them.

sections.title: How Websites Work: A Theoretical Overview
sections.desc: Introduction to how websites function and their basic structure.

sections.title: Common Website Vulnerabilities (e.g., SQL Injection, XSS)
sections.desc: Explanation of common vulnerabilities such as SQL Injection and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).

sections.title: Steps to Secure a Website: Theoretical Guidelines
sections.desc: Guidelines on steps to secure a website theoretically.

sections.title: The Role of Ethical Hackers in Website Security
sections.desc: How ethical hackers help secure websites.

items.title: Social Engineering and Human Vulnerabilities
items.description: Unveiling manipulation-based threats that exploit human weaknesses.

sections.title: Understanding Social Engineering Attacks
sections.desc: Exploring how social engineering attacks work.

sections.title: Psychological Tactics Used by Hackers
sections.desc: Psychological techniques attackers use to manipulate victims.

sections.title: Case Studies of Famous Social Engineering Attacks
sections.desc: Case studies of well-known attacks such as phishing and baiting.

sections.title: How to Prevent Social Engineering Attacks
sections.desc: Strategies to protect individuals and organizations from social engineering attacks.

items.title: Emerging Trends in Cybersecurity
items.description: Discussing the latest trends in cybersecurity, including the role of AI, IoT challenges, and the future of ethical hacking.

sections.title: The Role of AI and Machine Learning in Hacking and Defense
sections.desc: How AI and machine learning are used in cyberattacks and defense.

sections.title: The Future of Ethical Hacking: Opportunities and Challenges

sections.title: Careers in Cybersecurity and Ethical Hacking
sections.desc: Explore the growing career opportunities in cybersecurity and ethical hacking, and how you can build a successful career in this dynamic and ever-evolving field.
